nuxfrOPQTy6zomOnHIZpag.text: Our go to spot for KBBQ whenever we visit Vegas. Everytime we go it seems the service just gets better and better.  This time went with a party of 10 and ordered 2 large combos which turned out to be more then enough.  The staff and waiters are always friendly and attentive to all our needs.  I can honestly say this place is better then a lot of the kbbq places ive been to in Ktown Los Angeles.  Definitely will keep going back whenever visiting Vegas. Highly recommended.

f2biqQsP9vk6-mGPbjqQ6A.text: Wanted to check this place out because we like Korean BBQ. However, it is pricey for what it is.  They need to do something else if they're going to compete in the Korean BBQ business as magal and hobak are much better - as far as price. The meat itself is comparable. Also these restaurants are open later and 8oz closes at 11pm, and honey pig which is also decent, is open 24 hours (or almost).   My friend ordered the japchae and said it was not good.   I'd give this place another chance as it still was in its "soft opening" (they didn't have a lot of the non BBQ dishes available).

q6oERrcFTM7EHSD_PQhISA.text: I truly enjoy coming to this place. The food quality reminds me of KBBQ places in LA.  I'm from Korea from a place a little outside of Seoul and when i get a craving for BBQ I'll come here for sure. The only thing I wish they did was give you ability to pick and choose certain items from the set menu. I love pork belly but I'm not a fan of pork rib tips etc. I always order the jowl, pork belly and unseasoned short rib. Try it out..

f3M8eRCrHIbIIwvrURCj-Q.text: Recently moved from Ktown in LA to Vegas, I've spent depressed and restless days for eating below-averaged Korean foods (compared to Ktown in LA) in Vegas.  Tang tang tang is good but not reliable for it seems like they are changing their recipes/chefs every other day.  Honey pig is rubbish for listing on dirty dining several times and I just didn't go so that my good memories from "the Honey Pig" in Ktown doesn't get ruined.  Hobak, it was pretty good when it comes to foods but I was afraid to dine in with my infant in a stroller. (If servers' are carrying hot soups around, then they shouldn't be half-running around on the busy floor!)  Magal, me and my wife eats about 1.75  portions total. And we were not full with their small combo and it was an average meat quality. It seemed like they are following LA location's mistake. *Sorry for the long intro lol  So, when I saw this place opened up and I saw one single review that's comparing 8 oz to those places that I didn't like, I did not want to check this place out.  But I solely came here just because from the picture, it looked huge and so that i wouldn't have to worry about making a safe zone for my baby in a stroller lol But this place has the most potential to grow and eat up competitors in the vegas market.  First of all, meat quality. My server seemed to be so proud for they are serving USDA prime lol he was saying "we dont just serve black angus, we serve USDA prime" lol as i ordered beef tongue i asked him if that's a prime as well (for i know that beef tongue doesnt have a usda grade, it was a tricky question ;)) he told me what i was thinking. Good knowledge , service and training! Second, marination. I usually prefer to eat beef slightly seared or sous vide and torched surface and with good salt only. It's to taste the beef meat and enjoy itself. But their marinated beef such as bulgogi and galbi are superbbb. Sweet, salty, tender, smoky (my server seared the surface and smoked bulgogi and galbi with so much effort, thanks again!), and a slight sour kick from the pickled radish wrap. It was a beef heaven! And it's not like they used low quality beef to marinate. The quality was still good as fresh beef that they served. (Didnt ask if it was a prime as well lol) Also they had soon tofu soup came with the beef combo, and I was told that they serve it as a lunch menu on weekdays, 8 oz just became my lunch place from now. *I'm writing this from my phone and I'm getting tired, i will wrap it up. :)) Their interior, branding, layouts, service, and food just tells me that it will succeed and will likely survive in the market.  Oh they also have a full bar! Didn't see a bartender i guess it's because they are on soft opening but it will be awesome to enjoy my fav whiskey while eating good rib eye. My only, the only down side was that they didnt have cold noodles available. It is a must in Kbbq! But understandable for they are still on soft opening. Oh oh and they offered military discount, i was wowed and appreciated for it was my first time receiving one at a korean restaurant. Will come back to check out their lunch menu!

photos.caption: Photo of 8oz Korean Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Korean shaved ice free till the end of October as an opening special! It goes on sale starting November at around 5 bucks.

EQ279Thj2YNoaUB4PaZOrg.text: UPDATED:  Been back to 8 oz a few times already. Bummed they stopped their late night half off everything promotion. But, it's still probably my favorite KBBQ spot. We used to frequent Hoban and Magal, which are both within a few minutes, but no there's no need.  The meat here just tastes better and I know Hobak gets great quality meat. It does get lively toward the later hours on the weekends Fri & Sat. Happy to see this place getting busy.

zTqjKNwCdP_s9DZdO9RYEw.text: Just when I thought I knew all about Korean BBQ spots, 8oz KSH, proved me wrong!  This should be on your Las Vegas foodie list when you visit.  Upon entering, the decor really blows me away. Industrial with rustic undertones, the whole ambiance is very trendy and the industrial hoods that spread throughout the place rings True to the Korean BBQ theme. The food is well seasoned and get this, they serve it with cheese!!! What a game changer! Dipping your ribeye in cheese gives it a richness and zing that will have you asking yourself, Why didn't I think of that? Genius!  The servers were super attentive even cooking the meat and plating it for you. That's always a plus in my book!  The music is loud so it actually stimulates conversation and a lively atmosphere.  The owner even went to each table and greeted each of the guest. He takes his business seriously. Which is a must in this tough food industry. But with the combination of everything he has going; good food, good ambiance, good service. It's definitely a recipe for great success!

9NZBs_jn9nxF-Di4Fm_JGA.text: Simply delicious and the service is great.  The price is very reasonable, especially for the quality of meat.  Will be back for sure.

G9uub22012DNtdyXiEacvQ.text: Love this place for lunch. Super delicious meat cuts and soups. We got the rib fingers, boneless spare ribs, spicy tofu soup, and the short rib soup. Everything was well prepared and organized. Within a minute of being seated we were served some tasty bon chon. Normally I wait until the food comes, but I was hungry so I dove right into the bon chon before ordering. Great and friendly staff, they're all on top of it and they all hello each other out with their tables. Definitely one of the best kbbq in Vegas!

BflpX3_Bqj5OKtBpNuTLuw.text: Korean BBQ is a big thing for my bf and I. We love trying new places, so when we heard about 8oz we knew we had to come in and try it out.  Service: Our waiter was extremely attentive and very friendly. He was kind enough to explain any dish we were unfamiliar with. He also gave us a little bit of an insight to why the restaurant was named 8oz.   Food: The side dishes were plentiful and tasty. The flavor quality of meat is much more noticeable as opposed to other places we've tried. I especially enjoyed the miso pork belly. Yum! I'm a big fan of kimchi chigae and I was not at all disappointed.   Price: We're not to big of sticklers when it comes to paying for what we eat. If the quality is better, we expect higher pricing. We were pleasantly surprised when our bill came and it was less than what we expected.   Overall we were extremely pleased with our visit and can't wait to come back again in the near future!

-NPocfCbbj0Dr6K_Zvo86A.text: Had dinner at this new Korean BBQ place about couple weeks ago. I am not sure if they are full open yet since I still see their bar idle. However, I really like the vibe this restaurant gives- typical Korean environment, makes the experience different to all the rising Korean restaurants.   I ordered their kkotsal. It was given in a big portion. I thought it was enough to share between two girls, considering they give different kinds of side dishes. However, unless you order a course, if you only order one meat, they do not offer any soups, which was a disappointment for me, since the portion was already enough meat for us. Also, the service was exceptionally good. Jackson was very kind and prompt with our needs.  I just wish their drink prices were a little lower since they are more expensive than most of the other places. But other than that, I loved everything. I cant wait until their bar opens and they open till late night.

2MbjcfGxrWyQ5QsgBvO6ng.text: Our server was awesome I believe his name was Adam, it was our first time there so he gave us a comp shaved chocolate ice cream how awesome, will def be back.

fd1JZn1Cd9KGE5P8h7oNPg.text: I heard about this restaurant from multiple friends in LA. Several friends told me that this restaurant is way better than famous ones in LA.  No way! I didnt believe it, of course. As grown up in northern and SoCal , I have been to many Korean BBQ joints in LA, like Park's, khd, quarters, and I am always around them with my Korean friends and I thought I knew Korean BBQ very well.  I couldn't believe it until I came here finally and see it with my eyes. Yes, they were right, and this restaurant takes Korean BBQ to the next level.  Food, taste, quality of meat, atmosphere, service, cleaness, music, everything is amazing. If I have to pick three things I like most, it is Quality of meat, quality of meat, and quality of meat.  Their quality of meat is amazing!!   We went vegas couple weeks ago, it was saturday night.  The restaurant is a little off the street, kinda hidden. as we entered, I was immediately knew that my friends were right.  the place was busy, greeted right away and waited for about 15 minutes for the table (Although I should have done the reservation through fb).   Cool, industrial, modern, super clean hip atmosphere.. great sound system, they even have full bar and we sat at bars until our table is ready.. (my friend didn't tell me about bar)  Our server Howon, kindly went through their menu. Their menu was very simple; beef combo, pork combo and 8oz combo.  8oz combo has beef, pork and seafood mixed.  We ordered beef combo large, it was more than enough for 4.  Food came out timely, Howon takes care of us from the start to end, he pay attention to every little details.  Amazing services, very well trained staff. He explained which one is certified Angus beef, prime and wagyu. quality of meat, again amazing.  These guys know how to marinate, prepare, display and how to cook at the table. Howon explained little things like sauces, banchan.. maybe we look very new to kbbq.. haha.. their banchan is very fresh and has lots of flavor. radish wrap, kimchee, kimchee pancake, salads.. everything way better than any kbbq I ever tried.  Manager Jay stopped by our table multiple times to make sure everything is ok.. he picked up used napkins, empty bowls, we were treated as VIP..   They gave us free dessert, chocolate shaved ice.  they said this is free as their grand opening special and for limited time only.  We will definitely come back soon. We sometimes go hobak when we come to vegas and it was just okay.. it was always excused because we are not in LA. Now we found the best korean bbq in LV and happy to share my experiences.

z8d-Cydsqvzog8PO5MM8NQ.text: Visited this place again for a late lunch with my sister.  It was about 1:45 pm so the lunch crowd was gone and the place was empty so we had the restaurant all to ourselves.  Our server, Bora, was so pleasant and friendly.  She chatted with us while she cooked our food.  She also kept refilling the side dishes.  My favorite is the potato salad and radish.  My sister loved the fried  zucchini and tofu.  Everything was delicious.  The place is so clean and their meats are fresh and tasty.  Although the brisket doesn't have any taste to it,  dipping it in salt/pepper and sesame oil is really good.  The kalbi meat is marinated in soy sauce and other condiments.  The flavors are so tasty.  We also had the boneless short ribs (my least fave).  It was good but not as great as the kalbi or brisket.  The desert we had was amazing.  It's a must-try dessert.  It's flavored shaved ice dusted with cocoa powder and drizzled with condense milk.  Yummy!!! Overall, we were not disappointed.  This place is truly a great restaurant to go to if you're craving some Korean BBQ.  They are all so friendly.  I will return here over and over again.  Two thumbs up for this place

dNwoxIqEKi0g3le9aB6_Fw.text: This Korean bbq restaurant is a bit pricy compared to other Korean bbq places in town. Last time I was there, me and my buddies ordered a large beef combo that included marinated short ribs, brisket, skirt steak, and rib eye steak. Their meat quality is pretty high that all these meats were soft and tender! It's very nice that they switch out the grilling pan everytime you cook different types of meat since it makes a big difference in flavors. If you eat a lot (like me...), don't expect to get full from just ordering a combo menu. You might want to order extra meat such pork belly. After we were done eating, we ordered their dessert menu which was shaved ice with shaved chocolate on top. The description might sound pretty basic but it was just sweet enough to get rid of all the greasy flavor from the meats! I would definitely come back!!

RCME-gFeQvsitjBAhkkzhw.text: An absolute yes! If you've got a hankering for mean Korean BBQ in Las Vegas, give this place a gander. From their memorable service to the quality cuts of meat included in their combos, 8oz knows how to keep their customer base happy. While AYCE places certainly have their appeal, I always come out feeling like I've either overindulged or I haven't eaten enough to justify the price of AYCE. I've also become quite jaded with a lot of San Diego Korean BBQ places because either their meat quality has declined, their service is wanting, or their establishment is not up to cleanliness standards. Visiting this restaurant renewed my love of Korean BBQ and reminded me that you don't have to settle with substandard.   Myself along with two family members ordered the S Beef Combo which comes with beef brisket, galbi, and your choice between seasoned boneless short rib or grilled bulgogi. A difficult decision to make but bulgogi made the final cut. The menu was a bit tricky to understand at first, there's a lot going on and I had to take a minute or two to interpret it. You can choose to forgo the combos and order items ala carte but ordering each item individually is quite expensive (i.e. galbi is $38). This might work if you're just looking for a snack but for a full meal, it makes the most sense to order a combo. Even though the S Beef Combo is recommended for 2 people, if you're not ravenously hungry, 3 people can definitely get away with it.  With the combos, you have the option to choose one appetizer and one soup for the table. Our table was completely filled with various banchan, 2 steamed eggs/egg stews (we ordered an extra one that was not included in the combo and they comped it!) kimichi jigae and a cold radish flavored soup to cleanse the palate. The banchan selections were varied and plentiful and included fish cakes, bean sprouts, kimchi, fried squash, kimichi pancake, etc. Staff asked if we wanted the banchan refilled midway through our meal and were quick to replace our grill when necessary. I was very impressed by the various meats and their marinades. The brisket, galbi, and bulgogi were enormously flavorful and thanks to our wonderful servers who came by to help us cook, the meat came out perfectly cooked. While I don't mind cooking the meat myself, I have a tendency to overcook or even burn the thinner pieces of meat. The meat selections came with a vegetable skewer and a ramekin of cheese which eventually melted into cheesy goo. I don't like cheese with my Korean BBQ but if that's your thing, 8oz has you covered!  Overall, if you're looking for a solid meal and you're okay with a non-AYCE format, I'd recommend giving 8oz Korean Steak House a try.

SHqbz0Qz2mUc7moZ1jI1gQ.text: I was so excited to come here last night. The interior and decor is very similar to Hobak (due to the same owners) except more spacious. When we were seated, the side dishes were already on the table. The side dishes were varied and there seemed to be more of them than other KBBQ places.   The service here was fantastic, and our server was very attentive from the moment we sat down. We ordered the Beef Combo which comes with Beef Brisket, Galbi, and seasoned boneless short ribs. As our server cooked the brisket, the additional side dishes came such as the Spicy Seafood (Clam) Tofu Soup- so delicious. The soup wasn't too salty, the right amount of spiciness, and came with generous amounts of clams and tofu. The steamed egg dish was fluffy, soft, and really well done. The classic korean side pancakes were not oily at all like other ones, and had the right mochi consistancy. I love the variety in all the dishes here since they all go well mixed together.   My favorite dish of the night was the Spicy Rice Cakes! The Spicy Rice Cakes here are honestly the best I've ever had since the sauce was not oily or thick or too spicy like other places. It had a yummy buffalo-type flavored sauce, and the rice cakes themselves were soft and firm.   I'm not sure if the beef brisket was overcooked, but it was more chewy and dry compared to other brisket I've had elsewhere. I also do like my meat more rare, so make sure to specify this. The next two meat courses were phenomenal such as the Galbi and the Boneless Short Ribs. These were both extra tender and juicy and sweet from the seasoning. You can tell the quality of meat here trumps other KBBQ places.   I was very impressed with the complimentary matcha shaved snow dessert that came at the end. Most places serve you shaved ice, but this was actually frozen milk that came in little soft shards of ice that melted instantly in your mouth. It was a great way to end an incredible meal.

photos.caption: Photo of 8oz Korean Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef Brisket
Photo of 8oz Korean Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy Rice Cakes were the Bomb
Photo of 8oz Korean Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. complimentary matcha shaved snow. it literally melts in your mouth this was so good!

sLLAKEo9eLOlIcrUpYq8VA.text: I want to order 88oz every time I sit down!  Having originally been turned on to this spot by Unlokt, after a few visits over the past year, 8oz has become my go to Spring Mountain fix for KBBQ for a several reasons.   1. Almost never a wait.  Hallefuckinglujah!  I would rather eat my own eyeballs than sit for an hour plus pre-treating my clothes in bulgogi cologne prior to actually eating.  If there is a wait, unlike the other two popular places on the same street, they have a BAR!  GASP!!  Our dining party can hang indoors with alcohol and that beats the hell out of sitting on a bench (if you're lucky) staring at a bunch of strangers on their phones in 100 degree heat when the wait is too long (you know where).    2. I like the room a lot!  The lighting and clean atmosphere are great and it's spaced out well enough so you don't hear neighboring table talk.  This would be the best choice for a grill date or if you wanted to fire one of your employees (because pork belly will make them feel better after you do it) or to tell your parents that Alex is more than a friend.  The constant sound of the sizzle and jamming K-Pop cover it all up!  3. The excellent selection of banchan that I constantly request more of including their two salads.  Several meats I am a huge fan of include "rib finger" (I mean..who knew?), outside skirt, ribeye and anything associated with pork belly.       Is the A5 wagyu worth the splurge?  No.  At $180, the beef is of good quality, but their process for cooking it, which they do like any other piece on the menu, is multi-level wrong.  Sitting there watching the server cook it on a way too hot grill, cut it with scissors into micro pieces (kill me) and then push it to the side to move on to the next meat was like seeing a kid with a learners permit trying to drive a Ferrari.  Good beef like this needs to rest for a bit!  I had the same A5 Kagoshima wagyu the very next day at Kame and it was light years better all because of the cooking method.  It also shouldn't be advertised as Kobe beef because it isn't that.    Aside from that, I am confident about 8oz being a sure thing every time.  It is on my short list for KBBQ recommendations in Las Vegas and I'll be back pretty soon.        4.477777111129843984982 stars!!

3NnbUVNjA0EHJeqPiTbmPw.text: I thought Hobak was the reigning heavyweight champ of KBBQ in Sin City. 8oz is a formidable competitor to Hobak but something of the food seemed as delicious if not better about 8oz. The banchan was flavourful, good options and you just ask for more and they bring you more. We ordered the beef Kalbi combo for two and it was grilled for us just perfect. Even the tough gristle near the bone was cooked well enough to provide good flavour (although a bit chewy). 8oz is full service KBBQ like Hobak and the service is top notch. The dining atmosphere is upscale here and really exceptional.   The only downside is the exhaust fans do work well but my hair absorbs that sweet soya sauce smoky flavour like a sponge. Not the restaurants fault but if you are going here for a date night keep this in mind. Better fans could be helpful.   Otherwise come and enjoy that succulent grilled meat and eat your veggies. Mom said so.

Mp3mzEYvyvNCI9hrnR_0_Q.text: Excellent quality, wonderful attention to detail, and top-notch hospitality set this Korean BBQ above the rest. When we arrived, our table was set with a variety of delicious banchan. Our party of 6 ordered the A & D combos, which was a nice mix of beef and pork cuts, and it was more than enough food for us. h1-HgGgurWO8UIBg_3suWg.text: This is by far the best Korean Steak House I've eaten at. The meat quality is always at its highest every time I come here. The service is unmatched! They cook for you and are very attentive to your needs! The family and I cannot eat at any other Korean spot ever since we're come here (I've been to tons of Korean bbq spots in SoCal & Vegas)!   Also, the interior is well decorated and VERY CLEAN!!!  I definitely recommend this place!!!

w4osyuzEC9VnmVX-Louj0g.text: Decor - spacious, looks new, casual but nice atmosphere,  and comfortable   Service - excellent . My waitress was friendly, smiling, easy to talk to, and cooked my meal perfectly. Very responsive. And yes she was cute !   Banchan - fair selection but what was new for me was the dongchimi. It's like a pickled clear brine. Good for digesting i guess. Reminded me a bit of naengmyun broth(cold noodle soup). They also gave some sort of salad which looked very pretty. Also some bean sprouts with green onions in a soy like sauce.  Japan kobe ribeye wagyu - ask for the price before you order so you can decide. I've been craving it and it was my bday week. So I didn't care and ordered it without price checking. It was $180 but a good deal for a whole sized ribeye. I say about 10-12oz. Bigger than what I expected and cheaper than any other place I've seen where it can be $30 an ounce. I suggest you have it cooked rare to med rare and have it left off the grill when they cut it up but eat it however you want. My friend who was with me said it taste just like steak. I told Her to just eat her kalbi! Personally I love the flavor from the fatty rich oils of an A5 or A4. Not like I have it all the time. Got to spoil yourself or try something different once in a while! I craved the rich flavors(think of foiegras if you like that) for months . Definitely satisfied ~  Kalbi korean short ribs- I dare to say this is the best I've ever had . Seasoning and flavors were excellent. Not too sweet or salty. Very tender. You can tell you're eating quality meat. I don't normally order this because it's boring but man it was good . I would get this again if I came here. Also my waitress grilled the bone nicely and put good effort into cutting out the tendon part for you to it. So delicious   by now we way over ordered because I didn't realize the Kobe ribeye was that huge but   Pork jowl - it look damn good raw and even better as it was grilling. The nice browning colors as it cooked on the outside  and the nice white marble like color of the meat itself. Tasty and tender. What else would you need ?!  Steamed egg - maybe cause we ordered it and not given free like most places.  It was full of egg and soft. Blew me away.   Kimchi stew- I forgot what stew we actually ordered by then but I tried some just to try it . It was good but I tried to focus more on the meats   Dessert - complimentary . It was shaved ice milk topping on vanilla ice cream and chocolate syrup . Something like that . Looked nice and tasted okay!  I will come back here for sure to try other things like the beef finger meat ! Or well whenever I visit LV again ~  #jessteatit You either like it or you don't. You live once, might as well  try it once. Food is meant to be enjoyed. Eat it how you like !

-aWseQeF0t2wX3nsWp6hpw.text: Prob my fav Korean BBQ spot in town. It's not all you can eat but the portion sizes are pretty big and the quality is top notch. uBLIycdHFEw96MnvAO6iLg.text: I was recommend to go here by a friend so I already had high expectations and boyyyyyy! This place did not disappoint! I loved the overall look and feel of the place. Decided to bring in my mom and aunt here for their first KBBQ experience. We came into the restuarant about 11pm and were welcomed in by the friendly staff. We order the combo B. The banchan selection was excellent. My favorite would have to be the thin sliced radish HANDS DOWN. The soft tofu soup was amazing and the steamed egg was a nice change of pace. Now on to the stars of the show, the meat. Now I've been to GEN and I fell in love with their beef belly...but damn. I think I just found a new beef belly that holds my heart . It was so tender and flavorful! Next they brought out the jowl. Our cook/server cooked our meats to perfect done-ness. The jowl was just how I liked it! The pork bulgolgi had a nice spice to it! Last, but definitely not least, the marinated short rib. Now I've been to alot of KBBQ in the USA and Korea. I can say this without a doubt in my mind : this marinated short rib is SPOT ON to KBBQ in Korea. If you want an authentic taste, come here! Not only did our server cooked this to absolute perfection, she even deboned it for us! I work at a KBBQ in hawaii and I must say...this was on an entirely different level. I'll DEFINITELY will be coming here on my next visit !

ddYtYHvnYLWHZESAa3ydDA.text: Ate here last week and still dreaming about this place to this day. The meat is very high quality and all the sides were so delicious. My bf and I got the small beef combo ($60) and were afraid it wouldn't be enough food since we were starving, but it turned out to be a generous amount of food - so much so that we struggled to finish. My favorite meat in this combo was the short rib, my mouth is salivating just thinking about it!! It's so tender and flavorful.  All the combos also include your choice of soup and we opted for the tofu soup. I highly recommend this one! There's so much seafood in it and it was super tasty. Their steamed egg was spectacular and service was above and beyond. It's so nice not having to worry about cooking your own meat and our server cooked everything perfectly. They did also serve us dessert at the end of our meal which was this chocolate shaved ice and omgg we were scraping the plate lol, it was a nice and refreshing dessert. Oh and they do take reservations unlike many KBBQ places in town!

DeIcTznhP2UXScq21x-V9g.text: I loved this place and it was my idea to come here yesterday but I will never return after yesterday's visit. My boyfriend and I ordered 2 orders of the beef belly and the quality of meat oh my....has went from 10 being the best to 1 being so yucky and chewy. We could clearly see the thin white tendon strip down every piece of meat...how disappointing they could see it too but yet they didn't have a problem serving that to their customers. And they also took the cold soup away and didn't replace it with anything else...I guess I was one of the few that liked the cold soup...oh well 2 local customers lost forever. Bye bye the good 8oz...it was great while it lasted.

533xr2KJGwJ87uTwv0Vj6w.text: 8oz has the best quality KBBQ in the Vegas area! The beef was tender, perfectly marinated, and grilled to perfection. The sides are also refreshing and serve as the perfect accompaniment to the savory grilled meats. The service was not as friendly as fellow KBBQ joints across the street, but they got the job done. We will be back!

mgR1Cljohxwu3xa8HlQYCw.text: We went to 8 oz on a Saturday afternoon and it was empty.  Which was a nice change of pace compared to all the other kbbq places with long waits.  The interior was industrial and clean.  Modern.  Reminds me of LA style kbbq places.    Service was friendly. And banchan was yummy.  My faves were the egg battered zucchini, potato salad, radish, and fish cake.   The variety was nice compared to other places.  There were also 2 types of salads that were refreshing.   We ordered the from the group menu, Menu C and added an extra order of pork belly.  Aye.  Too much food.  Granted there was 2 adults and one tween. We couldn't finish everything.  With our meal came steamed egg and choice of soup, I chose the tofu soup which was pretty tasty.    Our waitress was nice and friendly and cooked all of our food. The downside was she never told us which sauce goes with what meat like in the other reviews.  Which is fine bc I'm Korean, but still would have been nice to get the same experience.     The meats were all good, higher quality then all you can eat places. But I really couldn't say it was the best I've ever had.  I've had better in LA.  The price point was a bit high as well.     Don't get me wrong, we enjoyed our meal and ate until we could pop but no complimentary desserts. And the higher price point, I don't know if I would be back?

uSeXrzJo0Mqu0Qrkf4DK0g.text: I am glad that I finally got to check this place out!  This place kind of reminds me of a place in Ktown LA area - Quarters, where it's a pretty trendy place that serves meat in quarter ounces. This place serves it in 8 ounces I believe.  We got the "Beef L combo", which came with beef brisket, marinated short rib, outside skirt, and boneless short rib. We also added an order of the pork belly.  The quality of meat here is superb. All the meats came out one by one and you can definitely taste the quality of the meat.  We also had a good amount of soju (fresh and the green grape) to go with our food.  The sides that came with the food were also tasty.  Our server,  Mario, was on top of everything.  He made sure our meats were cooked properly and that we did not go thirsty.   Overall,  I really like this place even though it's not all you can eat,  its still worth it!

i8PL8tzBPUdoqW_AgudC3A.text: I jizzed in my pants really hard when I first tried their short rib kalbi. The meat quality was top notch, and I called it the "best" KBBQ in Las Vegas. However, when I went back for a second time the flavors dropped and I felt the meat quality had also gone down a little. I'm probably crazy and making stuff up, but it wasn't the same.  Service is good though and definitely worth checking out at least once if you are in the mood for KBBQ that's NOT AYCE.

SV1Up0M8gN64mhql0bm0Hw.text: Hopping off the plane and headed straight here. It was a classic and rustic feel at the same time. I was so hungry I didn't take any pictures. We went in a group of 12 so we got this area with 3 tables together and two grills on each end table. I thought I was odd that the middle table didn't have a grill but it was how the vents were setup. It worked pretty well any ways. They had a lot of options of groups of meats. They had sides setup for you before you even sat down. The servers were very quiet. They did all the cooking at our grills so our only job is to eat. But it was really hard to hear when the server announced the type of meat or when it was ready. They us butter to grease the grill but beware it still pops at you whether you feel it or not. My glasses were so dirty when we finished. I couldn't tell you guys what we order because I just inhaled it all. It was just so delicious. It was a really good experience.

-yGe6Ts66F5fv2Cm41AIuA.text: 12/23/18:This place is amazing. They definitely have HIGH quality meat. Service is excellent and you can't go wrong with anything you order. This place is a "must" for Us whenever we are in Vegas.  Outstanding in all aspects and clean, too!! Trust me. We have been to several Korean restaurants and this one serves the best quality food. We stay away from All You Can Eat places because quality suffers. This place has tailored combinations to suit your cravings. Keep up the great work!  12/24/18: Again...you may be asking? YES! My family and I came here again for our Christmas Eve dinner. We cannot express how this is the best Korean Steakhouse in  town and we have been to several Korean steakhouses in Southern California so we know quality when we see/taste it! The owner, TK, is very personable and Milos, our server, was awesome!!

photos.caption: Photo of 8oz Korean Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_hbeqYPpjOmErGYB5qJDOw.text: Wow. Just wow. Well worth every dollar. My friend Carmen described the food as "orgasmic" LOL! Staff is incredible and on top of everything. Vicky and Ming were our servers and I hope I see them again. This place easily surpasses any other Korean BBQ spot I've ever been to.

Ox8esJOG_SjXhkUahdfRGQ.text: Excellent Korean bbq. Good for 2 but even better for a bigger group, the marinated  short rib was very good as well as the kimchi fried rice with egg

WrrX3f9zNTXQCoLEa23oMA.text: Came here for my fiance's birthday but also was recommended by a fellow yelper. We were greeted by the host and were seated fast. We looked at the menu and I knew what I wanted. However the waitress warned me if I order what I want I will be taking home plenty of take out boxes. So I went with her recommendation and it was right on point. The different cuts of meat was just right and it was not low quality. She checked on us numerous times and made sure we had plenty of extras such as kimchi and other things. It was very clean and everyone is so nice. I will be taking my friends here in the near future.

x_Bv96ub7icep4pvPZlX8A.text: This place was so amazing!! Even just the experience alone was perfect. The food was delicious!! There was not one dish we had that we did not think was perfect! The chicken, the Kobe, and the kimchi pancakes were my favorite! Great service too! I 100% recommend coming here!

f5f7V_TBehkE9zXyadtYDw.text: Since Vegas has opened up a bunch of Korean BBQ, I've been trying to branch out of my favorite place Hobak and try other places. This place is beautiful inside. However, I wasn't too pleased with the service.   We came here for dinner and it wasn't busy at all. We were greeted by a friendly hostess. We got seated and our server literally didn't even say a word to us.  He also didn't look too happy to be working there. Mind you, they had literally just opened for a week or two so I would assume they would be a little more welcoming. He didn't give us recommendations or anything, just came back after like 2 mins and asked if we were ready to order. Water wasn't given to us until way after he placed our order. He cooked really quickly and didn't give us napkins, so I asked for napkins and he literally just placed a stack in the middle of the table and ran away. I'm not really begging for excellent service but because of their price and ambiance, I would assume they would have better service than let's say a $15 AYCE KBBQ place. I don't think our server said more than 5 words to us. I wasn't paying attention to the other table he was serving, which were Koreans. I was thinking maybe language barrier he couldn't really talk to us, but it looked like he was the same way with that table.   The food wasn't bad, though. I still prefer Hobak more.

msc1SuHrfvFtPdwr_uv9XQ.text: So in Las Vegas there are a LOT of KBBQ here so I get tired of it very easily. This is one of the two places that are an exception for me. The meat here is so tender, especially the marinated beef and spicy pork. The banchan(side dishes) are delicious, and I would recommend the egg. The potato and zucchini is also good but it already comes with it regardless. This is a great place to eat with a lot of people or to catch up with someone. The service can be a bit iffy sometimes though. Hope this helps!

OE9U5Kq3_h_ZI5if8YmRMA.text: This place is so good.  Not AYCE but comparable to Hobak.  Will definitely try to come here with the husband.  The meat was so tender and fatty and tasty. We have the $100 combo among 4 of us and it was delicious.

_blWKCHzs6ithCOSE6BPSA.text: This place is not all you can eat . You have to order the combo there is some that's for two people about $55 - $65 Or you can get the combo that feeds 4 people.  But even tho it's not all you can eat the portions are really big . But let me tell you the meat here are to fresh and really really good u can tell it's not old and sitting out like a lot of these kbbq  and there is some one that will cook your food . They will cook it like a 4 course meal and serve you . The restaurant is really clean too it's not oily like your average kbbq so of your looking for a place where the food is super good and super fresh then this is it . Or only my new kbbq spot

0yPgz5_-R4N31TEh4GZ67Q.text: I LOVE THIS PLACE!!!! If you are looking for good quality meats this is the place to go! I guarantee you'll be full when walking out, even though it is not AYCE. The food was great and delicious! The service was excellent, they help you cook all the meats for you! The staff were very friendly and prompt! We ordered the combo C as it comes with beef and pork, a little of both! The quantity that was serve was just right  I would definitively be coming back here soon!

aBLb8Meg-sKt2CP1rz0oCg.text: Great atmosphere and service. Very clean (bathrooms too). Good was amazing! Will definitely be returning!

photos.caption: Photo of 8oz Korean Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kim Chee fried rice!

RX8S3o9GIYSeOWZXQPZJtg.text: great combination platters and sides! service was great and the style of korean bbq is similar to those in los angeles, ca. my boyfriend, best friends and i came before their major grand opening, and it wasn't very busy. quality of the chadol was not as good as hobak or magal, but overall, the pork jowel and short ribs were amazing. the kimchi bokkeumbap was delicious and the sides reminded me of some of my favorite childhood dishes!   ask the server for some direction of portions! i felt like my party didn't and regretted how big some of the portions were! the price point is similar to hobak and magal in town and despite my five star rating, i can't say this spot is better than either of those.   when we got here they said the bar items were not available to the full extent yet because everything was being created still. however, it was a good experience and we will definitely come back when they have more established in terms of their bar and food menus.   only thing we didn't care for was the steamed egg and kimchicheegae because despite how much we love those two sides normally, they weren't prepared right here. the steamed egg was too dry and not fluffy at all. texture was harder and dry, lacked flavor and overall was bland. the kimcheechigae tasted lackluster too because it was way too salty with lack of much content.   they came with our combo so we just didn't care much for them... however, everything else was quite good and worth having! combos had a good blend of different choice cut meats and sides.

DjnOSo9rgfCGTIbInqOGVg.text: If you try one new restaurant this month, make it this one! We came fairly early on a Thursday night (530) and had the place to ourselves. Extra attentive service..  it got packed around 7.   We tried the beef combo with short rib, and spicy chicken. I can't remember the name of the 2nd beef. All the meat was tender and flavorful. We tried steamed bun beef "tacos".. delicious...  and tofu clam soup. Yum!!! The kimchi pancake was delicious too.   So many flavors and so many dishes to try. But the portions are not too gigantic so you don't feel terribly full... It's really a fun thing to do with your friends.   Save room for dessert! The shaved ice with chocolate .. ...mind blown!   Cool vibes inside. Super friendly team of people that work there. They are just happy to be there and happy to serve you.   A++++

photos.caption: Photo of 8oz Korean Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. No regrets!
Photo of 8oz Korean Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Micro shaved creamy sweet ice, topped with chocolate powder, shaved chocolate, and chocolate drizzle. Melts in your mouth - literally!
Photo of 8oz Korean Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. So many things to try!!! It&#39;s definitely not boring!

ofxRklQP_2cM67JJw9Anmw.text: Brisket is on point. One of my new favs. Ate here twice in 3 days.  The side dishes are similar to other Korean BBQs. Servise is good, they will cook and turn the meat for you if you wish

btRIA32eZwyARNUCDRvIaA.text: First time coming into 8oz and my experience here was absolutely terrible and let me tell you why.   When we got to the host stand we were guided to our table and before I was about to sit there was food on the chair. While standing there and staring at the food, the host did absolutely nothing to ask what's wrong. So I had to ask him to wipe down the chair. All he did was swipe it onto the floor with his hand and walked away. We sat at the end of the chair away from the food stain because we were waiting on him to come back and wipe it with a sanitized towel but he never came back and as I'm halfway into my meal we are still sitting on the edge of our seats.   As our server came to greet us we ordered 2 drinks on their menu, he checked our IDs and went away. BY THE WAY, There was no greeting what so ever. Not even a "Hello" or "how are you." Just straight into ordering.    He came back and told us he cannot make the drinks and we would have to wait a little bit for them to be made because the bartender was gone. So I asked to speak to the manager, hoping he can make them, who was also gone. It's ridiculous how they have a bar menu and bar seating with no one knowing how to make any of the menu drinks.  To make things simpler for us I asked to order a well cranberry vodka and how much that would cost. 5 minutes later he tells me it's $10. I said that's ridiculous and no thank you. He comes back to me a few minutes later and said "Nvm, it's $8." So when I finally agreed for it to be made, he immediately says he cannot make it because he doesn't even know if they have cranberry juice. Why did you waste 10minutes of my time figuring out the price when you knew I was never going to be able to order it?   Finally, I asked the shift leader if they have any cramberry juice. He says, "yes it's only for cocktails though. And cant be used in a mix with vodka." He also mentioned customers can't even purchase cranberry juice by itself. Anyway, If cranberry vodka is not a cocktail then I don't know why they even have cranberry juice in stock.  The manager finally came in at the end of the meal and he told me yes they can make cranberry vodkas and yes they sell cranberry juice separately... except they don't have any in stock. He ended up making us the original 2 drinks we ordered... at the end of our meal.   At least you tried... and the food tastes great.  The only reason I'm giving 2 stars instead of 1 is because they at least tried to make a drink and the manager apologized when he finally arrived at the end of our meal.   Tip to management: if you cant provide cocktails to your guests... then don't hand them a cocktail menu right when they are seated and it would have never been a problem.

giOhSZ_2GsGxMFYZ3pJNNQ.text: Decided to check out a new korean bbq place. I ate at lot of korean bbq, let's say I've tried over 7 places in Las Vegas and in my life time 20 restaurants or maybe even more. Anyhow this is my favorite Korean bbq I've tried so far. They roll out the short ribs onto the grill and it was the softest short ribs I've ever tasted. It was softer than waygu beef! I'll be back again most definitely.   Server Ming gave amazing service Loved the restaurant industrial rustic theme.

1cIjlW8wCKyb4DuYaN0zOA.text: In town for an annual convention and came across this new Korean BBQ restaurant.  Thankfully, they accepted reservations.    Located in the Chinatown area of Las Vegas, 8oz Korean Steak House, offers a great variety of meats and other Korean dishes.  With so much competition for Korean BBQ, they differentiate themselves from the others with their quality of beef.  The interior decor is a lot nicer and more modern than most Korean BBQ restaurants and, their service is fantastic.  They have a full bar and offer more than just Korean beer.  I definitely recommend them when your craving Korean BBQ.  Great for groups, parties, or an intimate dining experience.  Enjoy.

PSVyTMtW3F2XChYyVn2MIQ.text: The Kobe beef was awesome and actually not insanely priced (relatively speaking to the places on the strip) 180$ for a 16oz steak. Soybean soup was also on point.  Would be a 5 rather than 4.5 in my mind though but for the brisket...was just sort of average compared to everything else we had.

CP9kZKyvoo9NSoPcLajmWA.text: This is a great Korean BBQ restaurant. The food was solid, service was good and the atmosphere was fun. I would definitely go back.

01mR4VrU-EaL6seP_e3-7g.text: New Korean BBQ restaurant located in China Town! Pretty spacious, open floor plan and seating, modern decor and a full bar.  First impression and vibe was good and the staff was friendly.    It was a Sunday afternoon around 1pm when we stopped by and there were a fair amount of people dining but no need to wait for a table, yay!  We ordered our favorite meats plus the staples you have to order along with the meat: steamed egg, soybean paste soup (tastier than it sounds) and we also received Korean tacos and kimchi pancake. The pancake was cooked perfectly, crispy on the outside and chewy on the inside. All the side dishes and sauces were flavorful and yummy. The meat was delicious and the egg and soup were very good too!  I love the fact that we have many options for Korean BBQ restaurants to choose from when we are in the mood for it. I grew up in Las Vegas and we used to have to drive to LA for decent K-BBQ. Well not any more!  The only reason I gave them 4 stars was due to the lack of organization among the staff, which i think is just part of the growing pains of opening a new restaurant and it wasn't too bad. I bet in few months it will be running like a smoothed oiled engine!

Photo of 8oz Korean Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steamed egg and soup

2to8ZGidgfYcaIYqRosgPg.text: First time trying this place and I am conflicted. First off, I love the decor and overall look of the place, very modern and looks like a fancy steak house.   No complaints with the quality of the food at all, everything we ordered we really enjoyed. The issue is with the service:  We got there around 7 and they were pretty packed, we were seated immediately and sides were brought out right away. Then we sat there for a long while waiting for the waitress to come to take our orders. She was very friendly but the rest of the service was not the best: -we asked for two glasses with ice which never came -we had to ask for napkins twice -we had to stop a staff and ask for drink re-fills and for more sides, they never came back to re-fill our waters -the guy that cooked our meats was very messy, he dumped the whole plate of garlic steak on the grill then put the pork belly right on top...I did not like the fact that the placed the non-marinated pork belly on the same grill as the garlic steak -they were so busy they just throw the meats on the grill, never told us what we were eating -we ended up grilling our own meat half the time because they rarely came back to check on us -we ordered lobster which never came  It was obvious that they were under-staffed, towards the end of our meal when a few tables have left, they came more often and cooked out meats. I felt that the female staff were great, Bora cleared out dirty plates, asked us if everything was ok, and cooked our meats neatly. Whereas the guys were very unfriendly, we asked for stuff and even though they did give us what we asked for they never reply to let us know that they heard us, they simply walked away which is rude.   I realize that this is in Chinatown and I usually don't expect much service from Chinatown, but the place is nice looking and gives a fancier vibe so I expected more service wise. Also, for the price we paid service should have been better.   I really like the place and the quality of the food, but service really annoyed me. There are cheaper KBBQ places with better service.

7Qfl6lk9Ymc1-PZWkdMlOQ.text: The food was good but the service needs to be better  Went there last night with a big party and the service has gone down hill.    First the water jugs was empty and no one came to refill it, considering we had 2 people cooking at our table because we had a big party, its weird that no one notice the water containers was empty.   Second, at one point the heat was up so high on one of our grills that the smoke was going right in to the face of 2 of our friends. This went on for like 5 min before i pulled the ventilator down closer to the food to stop the  the smoke.  So the waiter comes back, sees the the ventilator low and pulls it back up to continue cooking.  So after he pulls it back up the smoke starts going to the faces of my friends again. They were obviously waving their hands in front of their faces to get rid of the smoke. It was pork belly so the smoke was crazy... this goes on for another 5 min before the waiter realized what was going on and turned down the fire.  So after he turned down the fire and the pork belly coarse was done he tossed on the next pork dish.  So after he tossed it on, he never turned the fire back up.  So after 10 min of drinking and chatting with my friends i realize the the pork was not cooking at all and completely raw still.    At this time i had to wave down another waiter to come and turn the fire back up so our food can continue to cook.  After they tuned the fire back up and finished cooking, they never stopped by to check on our waters and basically we had to flag someone down if we wanted anything because no one came and checked on us.   All in all it wasn't a horrible experience, the food was good but the service was just so-so.  I took one star away for the smoke and raw meat on the grill for 10 min fiasco and another star for lack of attention after the meats were cooked.

_i47Goxi6usPbusTSJGsoQ.text: Food & Service here are top-notch! The meats are very good quality & they offer a nice variety of side dishes (bonchan). We also love their special chocolate/cream dessert...so yummy!

8Ic7WCfJcs31OsHGDt22FQ.text: Yummmmmmm. We were pleasantly surprised at the quality of 8oz!  They served an array of traditional side dishes that were of exception quality and very well prepared. Everything was seasoned perfectly!  Our server was hard working and made sure we left happy! We'll be back!!!

d1tx6XOS2fvf9_nywctPZQ.text: Yeah!  A Korean BBQ place that handles reservations.  That is great.  And it is NOT AYCE so that is good too.  I think.  My first impression was - clean, cool, roomy, tons of service.  Very nice first impression.  Nice bar and plenty of drink selections.  Menu - while not AYCE, they have all the types of meat you want, and they have some combo style menu selections that you can use.  I don't really care if the place is AYCE or not, I am going to order what I enjoy and I am not gonna over order because it is free.    The Combos - The combo at first to me was just a bit confusing.  They have A,B,C or D at varying prices, and A/B is for four people, C/D is for two.  A good selection of the best meats.  They also have the Beef or Port Combo, small or large. All are priced and all are reasonable.  Food - The quality was fantastic. Very good.  The large white beer was satisfying.  We had plenty to eat for the four of us.    With the combo, you could add some things, so we added the Egg Stew and the Tofu soup..  Very good.  The place is not overly busy on a Friday night, our waiter did disappear and leave us as he had another job, so we had to finally ask for a new waiter. That was a bit odd and the fact that no one really took care of us after.  But when he was there, our waiter was great, cooked up things nicely and spread it around and got us organized.  I will be back.

3AGxqKil8UmB1wh8trd6Pg.text: I've been going to this place quite often. The atmosphere is great. The restaurant looks modern, trendy, and clean. My girls and I were greeted as soon as we walked in, and we were seated within 5 minutes. The service is great, and I can tell that the servers want to provide the best experience possible for the guests. The meats were delicious and juicy, and I loved everything that was put on the table. I was overwhelmed because there were so many things to try! I am a music lover as well, and the music was upbeat and modern. I can tell that the owner really takes this business seriously and he wanted to create the best atmosphere possible.   P.S. Every time I go to KBBQ, my hair and clothes smell like meat/smoke, and that really bothers me; however, when I go to 8oz, my clothes and hair never smell afterwards. I know that many people wouldn't find this that important, but it actually matters to me.  I think they have a great ventilation system that won't leave you smelling like BBQ for the rest of the day! Overall 10/10.

photos.caption: Photo of 8oz Korean Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of 8oz Korean Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States

PyZr4oClPbIKo_0BxRO20g.text: Wonderful dining experience. Meat quality is fantastic! I have been to many KBBQ places here in Vegas and so far this is my favorite. It's not all you can eat but the amount of food they give you is perfect. We got the 1C combo which included beef brisket, rib finger pork belly and grilled pork bulgogi. You get two different salads, and we loved them so much we asked for more. You also get a choice of soup, we got the tofu, a egg stew, cheese fondu and kimchi pancake. I never had cheese fondu with my veggies at a KBBQ before, but HOT DAMN it was good. We loved all the sides, everything tasted well prepared. Most of the meats come from Nebraska, you can really taste the quality. Our server was Geri and he was awesome! They cook for you so you can enjoy your company. They have Wagyu A5 so I will be going back for that!  #shutthefrontdoor it was soooo good!

photos.caption: Photo of 8oz Korean Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. more yummy sides
Photo of 8oz Korean Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sides
Photo of 8oz Korean Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled pork bulgogi

R09jUfQI6NKPtvwyqHMZRA.text: This place is incredible! I've been to many Korean BBQ spots both near and far, and I still came away impressed! No it's not AYCE, but I promise you, if you do the math (I'm a Korean. I do a ton of math) and you factor in what you're getting. It's worth the small premium.   So what are you getting? Higher quality meat! Not even just a small jump in quality either! They even have a high grade Wagyu if that tells you something (not included in the combos). My party got the Beef Combo L, Pork Combo L, and Wagyu add-on. Every cut they brought us had immense flavor and just the right amount of marinade. The wait staff were all very attentive and courteous. The gentlemen cooking our meat was very knowledgeable and would recommend the best cook and tips on how to enjoy the meat, example for some of the non marinated, he recommended a hint of salt, etc.   In closing... every time I visit Las Vegas, I'm going to make an effort to try and come here! My parents even approved and they're usually the type that's critical of every Korean restaurant they go to.

84_g7tFsV4nVw3qp4w5ncg.text: The BEST Korean bbq experience I have had by far. Surprisingly did not leave smelling as potent of Korean food as other places. Prices were more steep than the other kbbq places but worth it if you prefer quality over quantity. The best part of it all is that they cook for you so you know everything is cooked right! They had a nice spread of side dishes. Will definitely be coming back on my next trip to Vegas. The place gets really busy so worth calling to try to make a reservation for a large group!

photos.caption: Photo of 8oz Korean Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Ot14zjTHzqidxqYq3MSapQ.text: This is probably one of my favorite late night Korean BBQ spots in town. They do not have AYCE. Everything is in a combo set or ala carte. We normally get the small beef combo or set D since I don't eat a lot of pork. Our favorite is the Galbi and the seasoned boneless short rib. I love that it comes with a stick of veggies (onion, mushroom, bell pepper) and melted cheese. If you don't eat red meat, the shrimp and scallop here are amazing. They squeeze lemon juice over it while it's cooking. It's very juicy and flavorful. I love that the server helps you cut and cook everything. They also have this shaved ice thing for dessert. The chocolate one is our favorite. It's very light and fluffy and not too sweet.  The service here is great. We've probably been here more than 10 times and it's always been consistent. One time my boyfriends credit card was accidentally charged twice and when he called the owner got back to him right away and voided the charge and offered him a discount on his next visit to the restaurant. Another time, the waitress spilled soup all over the table and some of it got on my purse. Luckily it was a clear soup, but they gave me a complimentary dessert martini to make up for it. I don't really drink but it was a nice gesture. This is a great place for larger groups as well. The way the tables are set up you can have 8-10 people and not have the group broken up.

_uUODk1Ld2uweV0VYB1VjQ.text: The decor inside is modern and clean. The tables are pretty spacious and not so smothered together. This is a great place for a large group of people. Great place for a birthday. The meat was good quality and the staff was helpful. The beef belly was so buttery and delicious. Get it. The combo plates are pretty decent sized for 2-3 people.  Parking is spacious, but I would try to call before coming to make sure there are tables or else you will have to wait.

photos.caption: Photo of 8oz Korean Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of 8oz Korean Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States

3-BQpSv1pQuUDPLxyrzQog.text: Highly impressed! It's hard for us to break away from our few favorite KBBQ joints here in town, but we had a larger party and I wanted to spend my Friday night eating delicious food, not waiting for a table. Fortunately, 8oz takes reservations.   We opted for Combo B, which gives you a nice balance of beef and pork. The beef belly was a great quality and was really flavorful. The galbi was juicy and the pork bulgogi had some nice heat behind it. The pork jowl was my favorite and will definitely order it again next time.   The banchan was well balanced, and the only clear standout was the kimchijeon. The gyeran jjim (egg stew) was underwhelming, but the doenjang jiggae was delicious.   If you are looking for traditional Korean BBQ, in a more upscale environment, check it out.

photos.caption: Photo of 8oz Korean Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Galbi in action

pVTLSTsKjxnm7sGFrwCWqA.text: Great spot that can accommodate large groups. Came here with 24 people when I was in Vegas recently. This is a great quality Korean bbq restaurant located off strip and I would definitely visit again. We ordered a la carte.  There are 2 primary things I will judge a Korean BBQ restaurants on. Meat quality and quality of the sides aka banchan and a lite third is the quality of the other dishes.  1. Meat quality was great here. They serve premium cuts of meat such as Wagyu.  2. Sides were great. Not only do they have a selection of Kim Chi, various pickles as well as an assortment of fried side dishes and other dishes (my fav is the potato and the raddish pickles).  The service here was also fantastic. We had a large group of 24 and they were super attentive. Often at times when we dine in large groups, service can drop a little but not the case here. It was also great to hear from great reviews from our Uber drive about this place on the way there (so it was definitely favored by locals!) We will definitely be back again.

uhL14xOS6twqdqRbSzzFWg.text: Great KBBQ, high quality and great value for the price of you get one of the combos. We got the beef combo for 2.  Equivalent to the best places in the Bay Area and LA. Also awesome service.

9zQeHqf9ZM02d6iyjsPZGA.text: Best high quality Korean bbq spot! Not an AYCE place, but they serve Premium prime cuts of meat, have friendly and helpful service, and a pretty beautiful array of meat selection and "appetizer" dishes.  *BACKSTORY: We came to splurge for my BF's belated birthday dinner. He's always wanted to try Wagyu and this place serves a huge cut of Kobe beef at market price!*  Anyways, Made reservations for 6pm and moved back the time to 6:30 with no hassle! (Be very careful with time! Although this was not the reason for us being late, this restaurant is located in a complex with very limited parking!) Upon entering, the beautiful 8 ounce sign and a nice lady welcomed us at the front and led us to our table which was already set with the side dishes and water! (the inside is much larger than expected, too!)   What we ordered: Kobe beef at market price(which on that day was $180), blueberry soju($12) and set D for two people($63) . (We honestly ordered too much for 2 people and ended up taking most of the last two dishes home). This also comes with two different Salads to share and Because of our order, it also came with the steamed egg and a side of soup. (We ordered the spicy tofu, which was DELICIOUS with the added seafood...mussels, clams, etc.)   THE KOBE BEEF IS AMAZING. Well honestly ALL the meat is amazing-very well seasoned and tender...And what's wonderful is that all the meat is brought one by one and cooked by the servers so there's no mess ups! (Lord knows how worried I was leading up to cooking the wagyu!) Nor ally, you're in charge of cooking the meat on your own, but this was a nice surprise seeing them be so attentive and making sure the meat we had was grilled and served properly. The attention to detail when cooking the meat was great (one of our two servers prepped the grill with swirling rosemary and then gently placed the meat on the grill, followed by rosemary again. She asked us exactly how we wanted it-medium rare, then cooked it, cut it, and plated it in front of us-all whole keeping a friendly conversation and telling us more about the restaurant and cuts of meat that are served. I appreciate that!) Afterwards came the veggies from the Kobe beef, and set D! (By this time we're getting pretty full, but because it's not AYCE, you can take the grilled meat home).   This place really does pay attention to detail with the numerous amounts of side dishes that accompany your meal, to the quality meats, and elevated service! It is definitely $$$ and something I wouldn't do too often, but the Set D on it's own as well as the different dishes could have me coming back even when I'm not feeling super fancy.   Thank you to Vicky and Howon for your service and making my boyfriend's belated birthday dinner go so smoothly!

photos.caption: Photo of 8oz Korean Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Set up before the rice, 2 salads, and tofu soup!
Photo of 8oz Korean Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kobe beef to celebrate his Birthday!
Photo of 8oz Korean Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Huge cut of Kobe beef at market price!

rBTcAnL5q7a6DXx6ZuYiKA.text: Hubby and I usually hit up a KBBQ place in whenever we're in town.  This time around, we checked out 8oz. We met up with some local friends here for a late night dinner.  It wasn't busy so we were able to grab a table pretty easily.  We ended up going with the large Beef combo and a separate order of soy garlic chicken (hubby got a lot of crap from our Korean friends for ordering that lol. He deserved it).  I have to say...the meat was great, every single cut. I would have preferred all non-marinated items but, alas, that is not how the menu works. That being said, the marinated stuff wasn't overly sweet like many other places.  Service was also pretty good.  We didn't have to lift a finger.  They did all the grilling, cutting, some serving.  They also have different grills for different cuts so we just left it to the servers to do their thing.  I'm pretty picky about KBBQ's due to the high quality I know is out there. Fortunately 8oz met all my expectations both in the meat and service area. Definitely will be on repeat for us whenever we're in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of 8oz Korean Steak House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The set up

F-lu5morjlwRkqfEy0lCag.text: Happy I got to try this place out due to a company dinner, food didn't come readily as expected due to our ginormous group and other guests. Don't be fooled! This place is actually pretty big, we were given the private area where they had sliding doors. Vents could have worked better, but we were not smoked like I was at 888 Korean BBQ. Im not quite sure what we ate since it was more like a pre fixed type dinner. Definitely had quality meat in our bellies and you must get their margarita, sadly I wasn't able to finish it. They have about 3 flavors and you have an option to get it with or without a beer/cider. The servers cook on the table side for you, so that you can have an enjoyable dinner without needing to pick a team leader to cook  no burning or overcooking any meat either. Just sit back, enjoy your drinks, company and good food!   Their dessert menu was lacking a bit, wasn't really into 'shaved ice'. Most likely would go elsewhere for dessert next time. I think the waitress told me the chocolate was the best tasting out of all their flavors.   This plaza is very crowded on Friday nights and the rest of the weekend, definitely not enough parking. I had to park on the street and others I know had to park either behind the building or at the furniture store. Carpool if you can!

Our server was vicki and ming. They were both so nice and vicki had great suggestions. Adding sesame oil to our salt was the best ! She also cooked everything to perfection. The kimchee soup and salads that come with your meal are to die for as well.  Ready for round 2!

SbFLcn_V7-vIE0sWyidGVA.text: This place rocks, it is actually kind of funny how I ended up here. We wanted to take our niece and nephew out to a KBBQ since they had never had it before, the AYCE I forget on saturday nights get CRAZY the wait is up to 1-2 hrs some times. So we called they had a table open we left one place to come here.  I will say in my experience, even when the meat is good some times the sides are lacking. I thought the sides here were very delicious indeed. I am sadend to say as much as I wanted to try the kimchi stew it had pork in it, which I do not eat unfortunately. I do understand that is the traditional way to make the stew so no hard feelings.   At the end of the meal, our server went on .. a break or lunch?? and no one came to finish up the rest of our table we sat for 25 minutes or so after we finished before I used my phone light to flag someone down for the bill, besides that little flaw no complaints from me

M7NDwz4Siz_3mBfpkv5qjQ.text: Update#2 - Back in town a year later and it is just as good as it was the first two times we had it. This is at the top of our list for places to eat when in Vegas.   Update#1 - Came back for the second night in a row because we were craving the short rib. Service was superb again with a different server. Had the spicy tofu stew and wow, big winner, you should pick this! This will be a must stop the next time I am in Vegas. Come get some great food!  Out here for work and happened across this outstanding Korean BBQ restaurant. First, super attentive and gracious service. David is an awesome server and really treated us well, ask for him when you go. The brisket, marinated short rib, outside skirt and pork belly is what we had and they were all fantastic with the marinated short rib as the clear winner. The accompanying side dishes were also super good with standouts in the cold kimchi soup, egg stew (like a souffle), and steamed buns. All in all we were very pleased and will definitely be back!

8oGAIW338nA4Dpp7d4sHvw.text: This is my go-to Korean BBQ whenever we go to Vegas. The food is seriously good and the staff is so good too, as much as they are handsome! I refer all my friends to go here during their Vegas trip and all of them are completely satisfied.

YDYlPgSAUE0P-Zw_36AIjA.text: This was the fourth time I have been here. So far hands down the best korean bbq here in vegas i have had. Our server this time around was Truston and we got great service and he cooked our food to perfection. Highly recommend you try this place if u want korean bbq.

cVthrGJ-YpZLT76OucUe-A.text: Absolutely exquisite and divine ... the introductory platters were divine and the meat beyond exceeded my expectations ! I will be back again ... thanks sooo much !

dRRoV3koTwixhx7lsGFlpw.text: Amazing place, honestly so good, I'm still dreaming about this meat. This places gives you the real True version of the meat without the marinade like some places. Soup was amazing as well, only complaint was that the beef bulbogi was weirdly minced, still great flavor though. We only tried the all beef combo but it was amazing. Good comparison to Hobak, only difference is that I think hobak uses marinade and 8unce doesn't. At least it seems like it. Again, would highly recommend this place

iyWZwtC8EWyfIuZK4adTOg.text: Out of 20-30 kbbq places I've tried this one is definitely the best one so far. Sides are on another level. Meat was great, and I got a cute Korean to cook my meat .

TLATocR4f4nXEeytjIc6KQ.text: We had super high expectations when we went to this Korean bbq and I wish wish wish it would have live up to the hype . There were 3 of us that dined together  . They do cook the meats for you which was a nice addition that some kbbq don't offer.   The interior is modern and nice for a Korean bbq .   We ordered one of the combo sets and were kind of disappointed . Our servers seemed like they were new or in training . They forgot our stew side and we had ordered cold spicy noodle and it  didn't come until we asked them . We also didn't get our steamed egg . The manager took the spicy noodle off the bill for the inconvenience and we didn't ask for that . Also he gave us a free dessert which was a shaved ice with chocolate dust .   The sides kept coming after we would eat them. They have cold soup (radish water ) which we love love love . There version is a little sweet which is ok . We got 2 different salad options as sides as well . They don't have cheesy corn but do have a cheesy fondue which works great with the beef almost like a Philly cheesesteak when dipped into the cheese .   The meats were good but nothing to write home about . We had the scallops and lobster as well which were cooked in a butter bomb .   There are positives . The ambience is nice . The service was attentive even if disjointed . They have all the alcohols that one would want ... wine / Korean beers and a wide selection of other beers . The price point and value are pretty good . It is very clean inside as well .   I'm not sure if we will be back because there are so many kbbq options in town . Goong on rainbow sets the bar and when we goto any other kbbq that's what we compare to.

vrCF0q91rNnf-O_0X0sPUA.text: Open late. Enjoyed the food here. Would recommend for anyone looking for kbbq. Lots of sides as well.

xv1tHE-YVbxbxkK0NXvkeQ.text: The quality of meat here is just top notch. They have a very nice salad, and the pancakes are tasty. A beautifully presented high-quality spot.

Xu3itKEj-5AYNPthGpoj3Q.text: As a Korean, I tried maybe over hundreds of Korean restaurants in Korea, LA, New York, and Philadelphia. Every time we visit Las Vegas. We tried almost all Korean restaurant and finally, at our last day.. we found this restaurant.  Wow, this is by far the best Korean BBQ I ever tried in my life. I can tell their meat is very very high quality, fresh, flavorful and tasty. Two thumbs up!!  The restaurant was full and we had to wait about 15 min to be seated. Interior is super clean and very modern. Their entire staffs were very attentive and treated us very well. Our server Howon cooked all our meats to perfect and it was getting better and better after every meats. We really enjoyed. Their banchan, meat quality, everything was better then any other Korean BBQ places in Vegas. I am super happy to find this restaurant.  We ordered four desserts and I can't describe.. omg, it is soooooo good. Never had this before. it was well worth it. Definitely coming back!
